page.title: 05DERBYSHIRE CRICKET CLUB
page.content: { Derbyshire County Cricket Club}was formed in 1873. The County Ground in Derby was first used as a race course and later as the headquarters for Derby County football team. A new pavillion called the{Lund Pavillion} has just been built. It has a bar, physiotherapy room, changing rooms and a restaurant. Around the ground are boards with sponsors' names on them. As cricket crowds have declined{ {sponsorship}has become an important part of the game. Sponsors help pay the players' wages. One of Derbyshire's famous cricketers is{Bob Taylor}who was England's wicket keeper for many years. He still holds the record for test match dismissals by a wicket keeper. Derbyshire also play at Chesterfield, Heanor and Buxton. They play three day matches and one day matches.
